I'm not sure that is a good rule of thumb.=A0=A0 It would depend on what yo=
ur cleanup 'settings' are.=A0 For example, if you have them turned up all t=
he way (max cleaning, in whatever context that means), that would be one cl=
eaning, but a whole LOT of modification to the original recording. On the o=
ther hand, if you have them set very low, and did 3 cleanings, that might n=
ot even add up to the one big cleaning.

So I agree you have to be careful =
on how much you clean, but the number of times you run the source through y=
our filters or processors isn't sufficient to decide if you've over process=
ed it: it is the settings, and the specific processors or programs, and the=
 kind of cleaning, and even the nature of the original signal, that would b=
e needed to decide if it was over processed.

So the safe thing is not to p=
rocess at all.=A0 :-)


--- On Mon, 5/18/09, Tom Arnold <topgun0123@sbcglob=
al.net> wrote:

From: Tom Arnold <topgun0123@...>
Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] I have a question.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, May 18=
, 2009, 7:38 AM











    
            
            


      
      I =
find on evps if you have to clean it more then twice leave it alone if once=
 or twice is a good thing and it comes out clear you are good to go.So if y=
ou have a poor evp you can hear it leave it.
Tom

--- On Mon, 5/18/09, Eric=
 VanDuzer <evanduzer@gmail. com> wrote:

From: Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@gma=
il. com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

Date: Monday, May 18, 2009, 9:11 AM




Now I may be biased to the "invest=
igation" way of doing things.=A0 I do clean up evps if I hear something and=
 can't make it out do to ambient noise.=A0 So hear is my question.=A0 When =
do you stop cleaning up?=A0 Wouldn't to much enhancing "taint" the results?=
=A0 To me the more enhancing you do the less convincing it becomes.=A0 I ho=
pe noone finds this offensive, it is not meant to be I am just really curio=
us.=A0 The way I look at it is that if you have to do so much enhancing to =
find anything, was there really something there to begin with.=A0 Are we ju=
st making ourselves believe there is something there??

Eric

 

      

  =
